resources.string: Calambeño
Settings
Looking
for a place to
Hang out?
Filipino and Chinese Cuisine
National Hwy Manila, Philippines 4027
www.davidsteahouse.net
Monday to Sunday : 10:00 AM to 10:00 PM

Davids Tea House is located along the National Highway. This is much convenient for regular and traveling customers who wants to eat Chinese food without the hassle of crowded malls in the city. Good food and great staffs make this our favorite place to be whenever we feel like eating out. Special occasions? They have a great space to accommodate those special occasions may it be business meetings to fabulous wedding receptions! Hey, did you know they deliver too? Yup, just consider the time the preparation and a delivery time when ordering. Hope this helps!

The place is clean and cozy but we were not so impressed by any of the food variants that we had. Maybe we just failed to choose the best food in the menu. The price we paid to my opinion is quite high. I am giving 3 stars not because of the food but because of the orderliness of the place.
Chinese Cuisine and Filipino
National Hwy, 4027, Calamba City, Laguna
Monday : 9:00 AM to 10:00 PM
Tuesday : 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM
Wednesday : 9:00 AM to 10:00 PM
Thrusday : 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM
Friday : 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM
Saturday : 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM
Sunday : 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM
Always a very nice place to eat. The staff are very kind and accommodating even to large groups. I like the lemon chicken
A nice restaurant People seems nice Presentation of the menu is superb I really liked the ambient lighting
Japanese Cuisine
Elejorde, 4027, Calamba City, Laguna
Monday to Sunday: 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM and 5:00 PM to 11:00 PM
My “Go-to” sushi place
Authentic Japanese food. I love it. I want to go here everyday.
Sisig and Other Filipino Homemade meals.
Crossing, 4027, Calamba City, Laguna
Monday to Sunday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM
The most famous sisig in Laguna. A go-to place for everyone with its great price with great flavor. Warm you stomachs with Ton-tons sizzling goods or add great dishes partnered with its soup.
The BEST SISIG IN WHOLE LAGUNA. THE BEST.

Just beside the St. John the Baptist church, you will see Dr. Jose Rizal’s family home where Jose Rizal grew up. This house is not the actual house due to the Japanese destroying it during the occupation. Rather, it is an accurate representation of the house that the Rizal’s lived. It has been transformed into a museum that houses The Rizal family’s heirlooms and history. It also exhibits items and artifacts used during the Spanish age and has a plethora of information about the Rizal family and Jose Rizal’s deeds.
J. P. Rizal St, Calamba, Laguna

There is no entrance fee for entering the shrine. Due to this, you will frequently see students from nearby universities and schools studying, relaxing, or doing their projects here for a convenient place to do their tasks.
The shrine also has a souvenir shop inside.
Francisco Mercado and Teodora Alonso, parents of Dr. Jose Rizal, is buried inside the shrine near a narra tree.
The well beside the shrine is not a reconstruction but is the actual well that the Rizal’s used. It is the most ancient object in the shrine.

Rizal Shrine is a must to appreciate the high ideals of every Filipino. Rizal bust in the souvenir shop is a million worth as a souvenir to every friend, home, officemates and constituents. For a minimum fee, you will be reminded of your wonderful experience of the Shrine. Truly a life worth living for.

It was suggested we visited Rizals shrine to give me (a UK citizen) a greater insight into the history of a national hero of the Philippines, this did not disappoint. His house was large and well the room displays well presented. The adjoining museum was also well present and informative, well worth a visit.

Built in 1859, St. John the Baptist Church is famous for its historical significance and is where the Philippine national hero, Dr. Jose Rizal, was baptized and frequently went to mass with his family. Since its construction, masses and services are still held to this day and devotees and tourists may visit its halls anytime.
Dr. Jose Rizal’s baptismal record has been found within the archives of this church and is still preserved to this day.
Throughout history, the church has survived countless earthquakes, typhoons, and was even burnt down during the Japanese occupation.
J. P. Rizal St, Calamba City, Laguna
Full of history and spacious area. Good for family bonding when going to Church.
Good old church. Overcrowded during Sunday. Very Small parking area.
Calamba City is an industrial city and one of the richest city in the whole Philippines. With that said, Calamba City is prominent amongst other competing cities in the Philippines.

Calamba started from humble beginnings when it was settled by our ancestors. The specific place is barangay sucol. This barangay resides in the shores of Laguna Bay and soon after, it was settled by Spanish hacienderos until Calamba is conjoined with Cabuyao City(Calamba and Cabuyao were formerly called "Tabuco".

Calamba then became independent in 1742. It became a Pueblo or a town in 1770. Fast forward to 1861 then it became the birthplace of Dr. Jose Protacio Rizal, the national hero of the Philippines. Since then, Many hardships like WWII(World war 2) and the thriving of the Philippines came and it became a city on April 21, 2001.
